discussion.content:
B
VLAN to VSAN mapping is a one-to-one relationship. Mapping multiple VSANs to a single VLAN instance is not supported. Note that both the VLAN instance and VSAN instance in an FCoE VLAN/VSAN mapping take up a hardware VLAN resource. Currently, there can be up to 31 VLAN/VSAN mappings supported on the Cisco Nexus 5000 Series switch. VLAN and VSAN numbering can range from 1-4096.

questions.question_text: Which statement about FCoE is true?

choices.A: FCoE is not supported on any Nexus 2000 Series Fabric Extenders.
choices.C: Inter-switch FCoE links can be configured to carry multiple VSANs.
choices.D: FCoE does not support NPV/NPIV mode.
choices.B: Not a single FCoE VLAN can map to multiple VSANs.

choices.C: On the server side, the amount of WWNNs must equal to the number of the vHBA interfaces.
choices.D: On the server side, each server must be allocated one WWPN.
choices.E: On the server side, each server must be allocated one WWNN.
choices.A: On the server side, the amount of WWPNs must equal to the number of the vHBA interfaces multiplied by two.
choices.B: On the server side, the amount of WWPNs must equal to the number of the vHBA interfaces.

questions.question_text:
You are designing a fabric interconnect and Cisco UCS blade chassis solution for a client. The solution includes two vHBA interfaces per server in the blade chassis.
Which two requirements for the servers to boot successfully are true? (Choose two.)
